replies.author: firdosebtc1

timeline.bodyText:
why is everything marked with important!?
Also ideally you should variables to make rebranding in future easier.
in fact what you have here is pure css, you are not using any of the advantages of sass as far as I can see; if you plan to use pure css, don't import sass as an additional dependency.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: It looks like all this CSS was imported from some other application. We should either delete it all and start over, or adjust it as needed. I avoided making many comments for this reason. Maybe we follow up on this in the next sync meeting.
replies.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: Since boostrap 4 is adding  _reboot.scss, to override some styles had to use "!important",we will try to  find a way to remove it
replies.author: firdosebtc1

timeline.bodyText:
important! should only be used when overruling an existing rule.
For a brand new application, it should not be needed at all; you should instead create well defined selector rules.
Also when you add it to every single rule, it becomes useless when you actually need it.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: some general rules for css specificity to consider: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/Specificity
replies.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: theme.css has space related css in entire layout. To make sure no other library(bootstrap) spacing effect on application  "!important" have been used.
replies.author: firdosebtc1

replies.bodyText: Since I can't see the future HTML using these styles it's hard to say, but just using more specific selectors should help. I would go down the @mixin route to have general "utility" styles apply to specific elements.
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText:
nit: indentation should be fixed to match our xml styleguide.
Also + is blue where as delete and edit are black, is that a design decision?
timeline.author: zohrehj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

replies.bodyText:
@zohrehj regarding this -Also + is blue where as delete and edit are black, is that a design decision?
Yes it is a design decision, since the design team felt that using same colors for all icons will not be suitable. The icon colors were decided based on the overall color scheme and the actions in question and their contextual prominence, and the placement of the icons. E.g. the - action is a secondary and counter action to the + action and needs to have a gray compared to the blue that the + has.
replies.author: SR-btc

replies.bodyText: sgtm, please resolve after addressing the indentation,
replies.author: zohrehj

timeline.bodyText: color is very faint. size is 12x12 where as all others are 24x24
timeline.author: zohrehj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>

replies.bodyText:
I left couple of other comments on the icon colors. I am assuming this refers to Trash/Delete icon color? If yes, that is by design to be a lighter grey than the other dark color used for more positive or neutral actions.
On the size, checked with the design team. 24x24 has been used for the + icon in screens where it is a standalone icon, and as 12x12 in other screens where it is part of a text button (+Add Site, for example which is a rectangular box with the text "+ Add Site" inside it) . So in the latter case, it needs to be smaller to keep the overall space taken by the action button to the optimum size. If we make both 24x24, the text button will look awkward. Hope this clarifies.
replies.author: SR-btc

replies.bodyText: Since this is an svg it doesn't really matter what size it is, we should be setting the correct size with css.
replies.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: yes we can do with css and we will take care of this in upcoming PR
replies.author: firdosebtc1

timeline.bodyText: size should be 24x24 to match other icons
timeline.author: zohrehj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
+<!-- Generator: Adobe Illustrator 24.1.1, SVG Export Plug-In . SVG Version: 6.00 Build 0)  -->
+<svg width="18" height="18" version="1.1" id="Layer_1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" x="0px" y="0px"

replies.bodyText: @zohrehj please see thread above -#417 (comment).
replies.author: SR-btc

timeline.bodyText: color does not match others. should be black.
timeline.author: zohrehj

replies.bodyText: There are blue and dark gray icons used in the screens for most of the icons. Blue is used for + (Add/Expand) kind of actions and the gray for Edit, Search, Collapse icons. In addition, Trash/Delete icon is made a lighter gray. This selection of colors for the icons is as per the visual designs (shared over Invision previously) created by design team which feels using the same color for all icons will not be suitable. The icon colors were decided based on the overall color scheme and the actions in question and their contextual prominence, and the placement of the icons. E.g. the - action is a secondary and counter action to the + action and needs to have a gray compared to the blue that the + has.
replies.author: SR-btc

replies.bodyText:
Please remove the xlsx file or explain why it is needed.

This xlsx file is required for import Participant functionality

+ * import './zone-flags.ts';
+ *
+ * The flags allowed in zone-flags.ts are listed here.

+ * The following flags will work for all browsers.
+ *
+ * (window as any).__Zone_disable_requestAnimationFrame = true; // disable patch requestAnimationFrame
+ * (window as any).__Zone_disable_on_property = true; // disable patch onProperty such as onclick

+ *
+ */
+
+/** *************************************************************************************************
